text.0: o the winds chariot o its power and glory crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder.
text.1: it makes the regions red and touches heaven and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.
text.2: along the traces of the wind they hurry they come to him as dames to an assembly.
text.3: borne on his car with these for his attendants the god speeds forth the universes monarch.
text.4: travelling on the paths of airs midregion no single day doth he take rest or slumber.
text.5: holy and earliestborn friend of the waters where did he spring and from what region came he.
text.6: germ of the world the deities vital spirit this god moves ever as his will inclines him.
text.7: his voice is heard his shape is ever viewless let us adore this wind with our oblation.
